description: This course prepares McNair Scholars for the rigors of academic writing. Because the enrolled
students represent a variety of disciplines, this course serves as a general introduction to
writing in research; it is not meant to replace discipline-specific research methods or writing
courses. Students read scholarly literature in their disciplines, write a literature review, draft
various sections of a research paper, and prepare for a formal poster presentation. Offered every
summer. Prerequisite: successful completion of First Year Seminar or Writing and Rhetoric.
fullname: McNair Research Writing Across the Disciplines
